    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor(double value)

        Returns color for the value and the color's Saturation in HSB color space is based on the value. Hue and Brightness are 1.0f except for some extreme cases.

        Colors returned by the function are the following:

        • if value is within interval [minimum,maximum] than the returned color is within interval [red,white] - simply several shades of red
        • if value is Double.NaN then returns Color.BLACK
        • if the value is Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY or Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY then returns Color.GRAY

        Specified by:
        getColor in interface Colorer
        Parameters:
        value - to be converted to a color
        Returns:
        Color object of the computed color

      • merge

        public Colorer merge(Colorer colorer)
              throws ColorerNotMergeableException
        Description copied from interface: Colorer
        Merges the given colorer to the actual colorer
        Specified by:
        merge in interface Colorer
        Parameters:
        colorer - the colorer to be merged into the actual one
        Returns:
        new colorer that was created by the merger
        Throws:
        ColorerNotMergeableException - when two incompatible colorers are intended to be merged
